file_insights.changes: Created new file containing three shared types extracted from analyzer.go
file_insights.purpose: Centralizes shared types used across agent implementations to avoid duplication
file_insights.structure: Contains AnalysisResult (for successful/failed analyses), FailedAnalysis (name and error), and AgentCreator (function type for creating sub-agents)

patterns_discovered: Type extraction pattern: Shared types are better centralized in a dedicated file rather than duplicated across multiple agent implementations
Function type pattern: AgentCreator uses type alias definition for function type consistency
Error handling pattern: Separate types for successful and failed analyses make error handling more explicit
gotchas_discovered: No gotchas reported for this session - the implementation proceeded smoothly

approach_outcome.approach: Extraction-first strategy: Created shared types file before extracting individual agents, establishing the foundation for better code organization
approach_outcome.benefits: Established clean separation of concerns, reduced code duplication, and created reusable type definitions
approach_outcome.impact: Successfully completed subtask 2-1, created foundation for remaining agent extractions

recommendations: Continue with the extraction pattern for DocumenterAgent and AIRulesGeneratorAgent
Maintain consistent package-level exports across all extracted agent files
Consider adding documentation comments to shared types in types.go for better API clarity
Test compilation after each extraction phase to catch any import issues early
